title: 1995 Ducati 916 at No Reserve
description: This 1995 Ducati 916 was assembled at the Cagiva Center factory in Varese, Italy in the model’s first year of production. It was placed in long-term storage in 2015 and has not been started since the seller's acquisition in 2022. Finished in red, the motorcycle is equipped with a 916cc desmodromic L-twin, Weber-Marelli electronic fuel injection, a six-speed transmission, adjustable suspension, Brembo triple disc brakes, 17" Brembo alloy wheels, an integrated clear windscreen, clip-on handlebars, a black vinyl Monoposto seat, and a carbon-fiber rear hugger. This 916 shows 11k miles and is offered at no reserve with a clean California title in the seller's name.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a No Reserve: 1995 Ducati 916 at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #183,572.
text: This 1995 Ducati 916 was assembled at the Cagiva Center factory in Varese, Italy in the model’s first year of production. It was placed in long-term storage in 2015 and has not been started since the seller’s acquisition in 2022. Finished in red, the motorcycle is equipped with a 916cc desmodromic L-twin, Weber-Marelli electronic fuel injection, a six-speed transmission, adjustable suspension, Brembo triple disc brakes, 17″ Brembo alloy wheels, an integrated clear windscreen, clip-on handlebars, a black vinyl Monoposto seat, and a carbon-fiber rear hugger. This 916 shows 11k miles and is offered at no reserve with a clean California title in the seller’s name. The Massimo Tamburini-designed bodywork is finished in red with silver decals and is mounted over a gold trellis frame. Features include a body-color front fender, dual headlights, an integrated clear windscreen, fairing-mounted mirrors, a 4.4-gallon fuel tank, a black vinyl Monoposto seat, a carbon-fiber rear hugger, and a side stand. Gold-finished 17″ three-spoke Brembo wheels are mounted with older Bridgestone tires. Adjustable suspension consists of a Showa 43mm inverted fork as well as an Öhlins monoshock mounted to the single-sided swingarm. Brembo braking components include four-piston calipers over dual 320mm floating discs up front as well as a two-piston caliper over a 220mm disc at the rear. Clip-on handlebars are secured below the upper triple clamp, which has a mounting point for the piston-style steering damper. Instrumentation consists of a 180-mph speedometer, a 13k-rpm tachometer, a coolant temperature gauge, and an array of indicator lights. The five-digit odometer shows 11k miles. The liquid-cooled 916cc L-twin was factory rated at 114 horsepower and 66 lb-ft of torque and features Weber-Marelli electronic fuel injection, four desmodromically actuated valves per cylinder, and a dual exhaust system with under-tail mufflers. The engine has not been started under current ownership. Close-up photos presented in the gallery show pitting and corrosion on various components. The motorcycle is equipped with a multi-plate dry clutch, a six-speed transmission, and a drive chain with a carbon-fiber upper guard. You are not connected to real-time updates. html:
This 1995 Ducati 916 was assembled at the Cagiva Center factory in Varese, Italy in the model’s first year of production. It was placed in long-term storage in 2015 and has not been started since the seller’s acquisition in 2022. Finished in red, the motorcycle is equipped with a 916cc desmodromic L-twin, Weber-Marelli electronic fuel injection, a six-speed transmission, adjustable suspension, Brembo triple disc brakes, 17″ Brembo alloy wheels, an integrated clear windscreen, clip-on handlebars, a black vinyl Monoposto seat, and a carbon-fiber rear hugger. This 916 shows 11k miles and is offered at no reserve with a clean California title in the seller’s name.

The Massimo Tamburini-designed bodywork is finished in red with silver decals and is mounted over a gold trellis frame. Features include a body-color front fender, dual headlights, an integrated clear windscreen, fairing-mounted mirrors, a 4.4-gallon fuel tank, a black vinyl Monoposto seat, a carbon-fiber rear hugger, and a side stand.

Gold-finished 17″ three-spoke Brembo wheels are mounted with older Bridgestone tires. Adjustable suspension consists of a Showa 43mm inverted fork as well as an Öhlins monoshock mounted to the single-sided swingarm. Brembo braking components include four-piston calipers over dual 320mm floating discs up front as well as a two-piston caliper over a 220mm disc at the rear.

Clip-on handlebars are secured below the upper triple clamp, which has a mounting point for the piston-style steering damper. Instrumentation consists of a 180-mph speedometer, a 13k-rpm tachometer, a coolant temperature gauge, and an array of indicator lights. The five-digit odometer shows 11k miles.

The liquid-cooled 916cc L-twin was factory rated at 114 horsepower and 66 lb-ft of torque and features Weber-Marelli electronic fuel injection, four desmodromically actuated valves per cylinder, and a dual exhaust system with under-tail mufflers. The engine has not been started under current ownership. Close-up photos presented in the gallery show pitting and corrosion on various components.

The motorcycle is equipped with a multi-plate dry clutch, a six-speed transmission, and a drive chain with a carbon-fiber upper guard.
